intro: Spiropetalum polyanthum, commonly known as the double-flowered spiral bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking, spiral-arranged, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of blue and violet. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lanceolate, hairy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or alpine habitats. The flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological importance in its native environment.
